video.name: EASY VEGAN BANANA BREAD RECIPE WITH TOASTED WALNUTS AND COCONUT – 1 BOWL | Vegan Richa Recipes
video.description:
Easy Vegan Banana Bread Recipe 

Get the WRITTEN RECIPE here — https://www.veganricha.com/vegan-banana-bread-toasted-walnuts-coconut/

SUBSCRIBE HERE: https://www.youtube.com/veganricharecipes?sub_confirmation=1

Vegan Banana Bread with Walnuts. Classic Super moist Banana bread with toasted nuts and coconut. No Palm oil. Vegan Recipe. 1 Bowl or 1 Blender.

Its slightly different from the classic pound cake like banana bread. This version inspired by the many tips on serious eats, has shredded coconut, coconut oil, toasted nuts and lots more spice. The resulting loaf is a caremelly, bananey, nutty goodness, that you want to snack on morning and evening. 

The bread is like a less sweet pound cake with amazing texture. I like to toast the walnuts and the coconut for deeper flavor. Add spices of choice. I use cinnamon, cardamom, nutmeg. These Bakery style Banana bread is great as is or with a drizzle of maple. If you use very ripe bananas and add in dried fruit like dates and currants, you can omit the added sugar. 

******MORE BREAKFAST BAKES FROM THE BLOG******

BANANA WALNUT BREAKFAST LOAF: https://www.veganricha.com/banana-walnut-breakfast-loaf-gluten/

1 BOWL VEGAN PUMPKIN BREAD: https://www.veganricha.com/1-bowl-vegan-pumpkin-bread-recipe/

MARBLED TURMERIC PUMPKIN CHOCOLATE BREAD: https://www.veganricha.com/marbled-turmeric-pumpkin-chocolate-bread/

COOKBOOKS BY RICHA HINGLE (VEGAN RICHA): https://www.veganricha.com/mybooks/

Connect with me on Social Media:

FACEBOOK: https://www.facebook.com/VeganRicha

INSTAGRAM: https://instagram.com/veganricha

PINTEREST: https://www.pinterest.com/veganricha/

TWITTER: https://twitter.com/veganricha

Music epidemic sound

#bananabread #veganbreadrecipe #breakfastbake #veganricha #easyveganrecipes

recipeIngredient: 1¾ cup flour (I use 1 cup spelt/white whole wheat + ¾ cup unbleached white flour)
1 1/4 tsp ground spices or spice blend of choice
A few tablespoons of toasted walnuts or pecans (plus more for garnish)
A few tablespoons vegan chocolate chunks (dried fruit like currants, chopped dates or other additions)
2  large ripe bananas or 3 medium (1 cup if well mashed, heaping 1 cup if sliced)
3 to 4 tbsp coconut sugar or other sugar (depends on the sweetness of the bananas)
3 tbsp coconut oil melted ( or other oil or use smooth nut butter)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 365 degrees F / 180ºc. Line a 8.5 by 4.5 or 9 by 5 inch loaf pan with parchment.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat the oven to 365 degrees F / 180ºc. Line a 8.5 by 4.5 or 9 by 5 inch loaf pan with parchment.

recipeInstructions.text: Toast the nuts if you havent already on a dry skillet over medium heat for 3 to 4 mins. Stir occasionally. Mix in the coconut in the last 30 seconds to toast slightly and set aside. This step is optional.
recipeInstructions.name: Toast the nuts if you havent already on a dry skillet over medium heat for 3 to 4 mins. Stir occasionally. Mix in the coconut in the last 30 seconds to toast slightly and set aside. This step is optional.

recipeInstructions.text: In a bowl whisk the dry ingredients flour through salt, including salt really well. Add the nuts and other additions if using and mix in.
recipeInstructions.name: In a bowl whisk the dry ingredients flour through salt, including salt really well. Add the nuts and other additions if using and mix in.

recipeInstructions.text: In a blender, add all the wet ingredients maple through vanilla extract and blend until smooth. (You can also mash the banana in a bowl until smooth then mix in the rest if the wet ingredients).
recipeInstructions.name: In a blender, add all the wet ingredients maple through vanilla extract and blend until smooth. (You can also mash the banana in a bowl until smooth then mix in the rest if the wet ingredients).

recipeInstructions.text: Add to the dry ingredients. Mix until well combined into a somewhat muffin like batter.
recipeInstructions.name: Add to the dry ingredients. Mix until well combined into a somewhat muffin like batter.

recipeInstructions.text: Transfer batter to parchment lined loaf pan. Sprinkle chopped nuts or chocolate on top (optional).
recipeInstructions.name: Transfer batter to parchment lined loaf pan. Sprinkle chopped nuts or chocolate on top (optional).

recipeInstructions.text: Bake for 40 minutes at 365 degrees F / 180ºc.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake for 40 minutes at 365 degrees F / 180ºc.

recipeInstructions.text: Reduce heat to 350 degrees F / 170ºc. Bake for 10 to 15 minutes or until toothpick from the center comes out almost clean.
recipeInstructions.name: Reduce heat to 350 degrees F / 170ºc. Bake for 10 to 15 minutes or until toothpick from the center comes out almost clean.

recipeInstructions.text: Cool for 10 minutes in the pan. Remove from the pan. Cool completely before slicing. Store on the counter for the day, refrigerated for upto 5 days, frozen tightly wrapped for upto a month.
recipeInstructions.name: Cool for 10 minutes in the pan. Remove from the pan. Cool completely before slicing. Store on the counter for the day, refrigerated for upto 5 days, frozen tightly wrapped for upto a month.
